item.title: Kelly add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Kelly add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Jodi Picoult
item.description: "In the space between yes and no, there's a lifetime. It's the difference between the path you walk and the one you leave behind; it's the gap between who you thought you could be and who you really are; its the legroom for the lies you'll tell yourself in the future." -- Jodi Picoult

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Joan Didion
item.description: "I don't know what I think until I write it down." -- Joan Didion

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Jeannette Walls
item.description: "One time I saw a tiny Joshua tree sapling growing not too far from the old tree. I wanted to dig it up and replant it near our house. I told Mom that I would protect it from the wind and water it every day so that it could grow nice and tall and straight. Mom frowned at me. "You'd be destroying what makes it special," she said. "It's the Joshua tree's struggle that gives it its beauty." -- Jeannette Walls

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Jeannette Walls
item.description: "....he said it was interesting. He used the word 'textured'. He said 'smooth' is boring but 'textured' was interesting, and the scar meant that I was stronger than whatever had tried to hurt me." -- Jeannette Walls

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Jeannette Walls
item.description: "Life is a drama full of tragedy and comedy. You should learn to enjoy the comic episodes a little more." -- Jeannette Walls

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Friedrich Nietzche
item.description: "When man does not have firm, calm lines on the horizon of his life- mountain and forest lines, as it were- then a man's innermost will becomes agitated, preoccupied, and wistful." -- Friedrich Nietzche

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "People say that what we’re all seeking is a meaning for life. I don’t think that’s what we’re really seeking. I think that what we’re seeking is an experience of being alive, so that our life experiences on the purely physical plane will have resonances with our own innermost being and reality, so that we actually feel the rapture of being alive." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Eventually, I sickened of people, myself included, who didn't think enough of themselves to make something of themselves- people who did only what they had to and never what they could have done. I learned from them the infected loneliness that comes at the end of every misspent day. I knew I could do better." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Bill Withers
item.description: "I've always been serious that way, trying to evolve to a more conscious state. Funny thing about that,though. You tweak yourself,looking for more love, less lust, more compassion, less jealousy. You keep tweaking, keep adjusting those knobs until you can no longer find the original settings. In some sense,the original settings are exactly what I'm looking for-a return to the easygoing guy i was before my world got complicated, the nice guy who took things as they came and laughed so hard the blues would blow away in the summer wind." -- Bill Withers

item.title: Kelly add a quote by H.T. Leslie
item.description: "The game of life is not so much in holding a good hand as playing a poor hand well." -- H.T. Leslie

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "There is no abstract art. You must always start with something. Afterward you can remove all traces of reality." -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Kelly add a quote by William Shedd
item.description: "A ship in the harbor is safe, but that's not what ships are built for." -- William Shedd

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Tom Lehrer
item.description: "I wish people who have trouble communicating would just shut up." -- Tom Lehrer

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Demosthenes
item.description: "Nothing is easier than self-deceit. For what every man wishes, that he also beleives to be true." -- Demosthenes

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Donald Barthelme
item.description: "This muck heaves and palpitates. It is multi-directional and has a mayor." -- Donald Barthelme

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Aron Ralston
item.description: "You'll never find your limits until you've gone too far." -- Aron Ralston

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni
item.description: "Believe nothing, no matter where you read it, or who said it, no matter if I have said it, unless it agrees with your own reason and your own common sense." -- Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Martha Clark
item.description: "Martha told me, "I don't know how you're going to talk about romance in your book, but you're going to have to because its truly part of all our lives down there-and in a big way- because its an incredibly sensuous environment. Think of how many times you've fallen in love down there, and how many times people have fallen in love with you. Its a place where we shine. We're the happiest in our lives. We're vibrant. We're just so full of life, and not only does that put you in the mood for love, it sets you up for it. People are really drawn to people who are shining, who feel so happy where they are and who they are and what they're doing and who they're doing it with." -- Martha Clark

item.title: Kelly add a quote by haruki murakami
item.description: "Pain is inevitable. Suffering is optional." -- haruki murakami

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Veronique Vienne
item.description: "To be enlightened is to know oneself and not run away." -- Veronique Vienne

item.title: Kelly add a quote by the police
item.description: "Every little thing she does is magic." -- the police

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Bill Cosby
item.description:
"I’m supposed to figure out if the glass is half full or half empty,” I told her.
Without a moment’s hesitation, in a split second, my grandmother shrugged and said: “It depends on if you’re drinking or pouring." -- Bill Cosby

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "The point of marriage is not to create a quick commonality by tearing down all boundaries; on the contrary, a good marriage is one in which each partner appoints the other to be the guardian of his solitude, and thus they show each other the greatest possible trust. A merging of two people is an impossibility, and where it seems to exist, it is a hemming-in, a mutual consent that robs one party or both parties of their fullest freedom and development. But once the realization is accepted that even between the closest people infinite distances exist, a marvelous living side-by-side can grow up for them, if they succeed in loving the expanse between them, which gives them the possibility of always seeing each other as a whole and before an immense sky." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "I hold this to be the highest task of a bond between two people: that each should stand guard over the solitude of the other." -- Rainer Maria Rilke
